etymologies: early 17th century: from Turkish şerbet, Persian šerbet, from Arabic šarba ‘drink’, from šariba ‘to drink’. Compare with syrup

notes.text: The tendency to insert an r into the second syllable of sherbet is common; the misspelling sherbert accounts for around a quarter of the citations for the word in the Oxford English Corpus

definitions: a frozen dessert made with fruit juice added to milk or cream, egg white, or gelatin.
shortDefinitions: frozen dessert made with fruit juice added to milk or cream

definitions: a frozen fruit juice and sugar mixture served as a dessert or between courses of a meal to cleanse the palate.
shortDefinitions: frozen fruit juice and sugar mixture served as dessert or between courses of meal

definitions: (especially in Arab countries) a cooling drink of sweet diluted fruit juices.
shortDefinitions: cooling drink of sweet diluted fruit juices

definitions: a flavored sweet effervescent powder eaten alone or made into a drink.
shortDefinitions: flavored sweet effervescent powder eaten alone or made into drink
